variables.name: EEPROM_STATUS
variables.comment: The status of the BMS's EEPROM. 0 => Hardware failure, 1 => Memory invalid, 3 => Memory valid.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_STEINHART_HART_A
variables.comment: The A coefficient of the thermistors' Steinhart-Hart equation.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_STEINHART_HART_B
variables.comment: The B coefficient of the thermistors' Steinhart-Hart equation.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_STEINHART_HART_C
variables.comment: The C coefficient of the thermistors' Steinhart-Hart equation.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_STEINHART_HART_D
variables.comment: The D coefficient of the thermistors' Steinhart-Hart equation.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_REFERENCE_RESISTANCE
variables.comment: The reference resistance of the thermistors' Steinhart-Hart equation.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_PULLUP_RESISTANCE
variables.comment: The pull-up resistance of the thermistors' divider circuit.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_TEMPERATURE_MIN
variables.comment: The minimum plausible temperature of the thermistors' used to detect open-circuit faults.

variables.name: THERMISTORS_TEMPERATURE_MAX
variables.comment: The maximum plausible temperature of the thermistors' used to detect short-circuit faults.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_1_SENSITIVITY
variables.comment: The sensitiviy of the current sensor's first (low-range) channel, in amps per count.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_1_SAMPLE_OFFSET
variables.comment: The offset of the current sensor's first (low-range) channel, in counts.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_1_SAMPLE_MIN
variables.comment: The minimum plausible sample of the current sensor's first (low-range) channel, before offset.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_1_SAMPLE_MAX
variables.comment: The maximum plausible sample of the current sensor's first (low-range) channel, before offset.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_2_SENSITIVITY
variables.comment: The sensitiviy of the current sensor's second (high-range) channel, in amps per count.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_2_SAMPLE_OFFSET
variables.comment: The offset of the current sensor's second (high-range) channel, in counts.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_2_SAMPLE_MIN
variables.comment: The minimum plausible sample of the current sensor's second (high-range) channel, before offset.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_2_SAMPLE_MAX
variables.comment: The maximum plausible sample of the current sensor's second (high-range) channel, before offset.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_1_SATURATION_CURRENT
variables.comment: The current at which channel 1 of the current sensor saturates (positive and negative).

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_DEADZONE_CURRENT
variables.comment: The magnitude of current below which to clamp to the output 0A.

variables.name: CHARGING_VOLTAGE_LIMIT
variables.comment: The voltage limit to set the charger to.

variables.name: CHARGING_CURRENT_LIMIT
variables.comment: The current limit to set the charger to.

variables.name: CHARGING_POWER_LIMIT
variables.comment: The power limit to apply to the charger.

variables.name: CHARGING_THRESHOLD
variables.comment: The voltage threshold at which the is accumulator considered to be fully charged.

variables.name: BALANCING_ENABLED
variables.comment: Indicates whether balancing is allowed. 0 => Off, 1 => On.

variables.name: CHARGING_ENABLED
variables.comment: Indicates whether charging is allowed. 0 => Off, 1 => On.

variables.name: BALANCING_THRESHOLD
variables.comment: The voltage threshold at which a cell is considered out of balance with the minimum cell.

variables.name: LTC_TEMPERATURE_MAX
variables.comment: The die temperature which an LTC is not allowed to exceed, in Celsius.

variables.name: POWER_ROLLING_AVERAGE_COUNT
variables.comment: The number of samples to include the rolling average for instantaneous power delivery.

variables.name: CELL_VOLTAGE_MIN
variables.comment: The minimum allowable cell voltage, any lower indicates a fault condition.

variables.name: CELL_VOLTAGE_MAX
variables.comment: The maximum allowable cell voltage, any higher indicates a fault condition.

variables.name: CELL_VOLTAGE_FAULT_THRESHOLD
variables.comment: The maximum number of faulted cell voltage samples until a cell voltage fault is thrown.

variables.name: TEMPERATURE_FAULT_THRESHOLD
variables.comment: The maximum number of faulted temperature samples until a temperature fault is thrown.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_1_SAMPLE
variables.comment: The ADC sample of the current sensor's channel 1.

variables.name: CURRENT_SENSOR_CHANNEL_2_SAMPLE
variables.comment: The ADC sample of the current sensor's channel 2.

variables.name: WATCHDOG_TRIGGER
variables.comment: Command for triggering the BMS's watchdog. The value written does not matter.

variables.name: CELL_DISCHARGE_DISABLE
variables.comment: Command for disabling a cell's discharge resistor. Written value should be the index of the cell.

variables.name: CELL_DISCHARGE_ENABLE
variables.comment: Command for enabling a cell's discharge resistor. Written value should be the index of the cell.
